intro: Lantana leucocarpa, commonly known as white lantana, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 3 meters, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Lantana leucocarpa is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
